business.headline: 5 simple tips to get personal loans at lowest interest ratesThis article guides you through five effective strategies to secure personal loans at the most competitive interest rates, ensuring you make informed financial decisions and reduce your overall borrowing costs.

Why 8th Pay Commission is spurring calls for income tax relief in BudgetWith government employees set to benefit from a pay hike from the 8th Pay Commission, private sector employees are demanding income tax relief to boost their disposable income. Experts argue that easing the tax burden on individuals is key to spurring consumption, the backbone of India's economic growth.
Sensex ends over 400 points lower, Nifty falls as IT stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 423.49 points lower at the closing bell, whil the NSE Nifty50 settled 108.60 points lower at 23,203.20.
How long before 8th Pay Commission benefits reach central government employees?The 7th Pay Commission took around 22 months from its formation to the implementation of its recommendations.

Is artificial intelligence the new wolf of Wall Street?A recent Bloomberg Intelligence report stated that major Wall Street banks, including Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Goldman Sachs, may slash up to 200,000 jobs in the coming 3-5 years.
Bad credit? Here's how you can still secure emergency fundsThough bad credit limits borrowing options and raises interest rates, some lenders still offer loans.
Is EPF to NPS transfer possible? Check the details hereThe decision to transfer EPF to NPS must align with your financial goals, liquidity needs, and risk appetite.

8th Pay Commission: How much salary increase can government employees expect?Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the decision and said that the commission would be formed soon to revise the pay structure for central government employees and pensioners.
Will India's growth story gain momentum or slow down in FY26?India's GDP, which clocked a stellar 9.7% in FY22 before settling at 7% in FY23 and 8.2% in FY24, has been on a roller-coaster ride.

Axis Bank shares drop 6% to hit 52-week low. Should you buy? Axis Bank share price: The stock closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

8th Pay Commission: What is fitment factor that determines salary hikeThe salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay.
Reliance share price rises over 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy now? Reliance's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Explained: Why Infosys share price tumbled over 5% after strong Q3 resultsInfosys stock was down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 a.m. The company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.

Sensex drops 750 points. Why did stock market fall in early trade?Stock market down today: The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys' shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast.

Sensex drops 400 points: Markets tank as IT stocks fall; Infosys down 5%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 430.02 points to 76,612.80, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 121.05 points to 23,190.75 as of 9:22 AM.

Donald Trump plans to make cryptocurrency a national priority: ReportThe order will designate cryptocurrency as a national imperative, encouraging government agencies to collaborate with the industry.

RIL shares in focus today post Q3 results: 5 things investors need to know RIL posted a 12% year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to a record Rs 21,930 crore for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 (FY25).

8th Pay Commission: Will pensions see a big jump? Here's what you need to knowThe Union Cabinet approved the 8th Pay Commission on Thursday to revise the salaries of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision and said that the commission will likely be established soon.
8 key expectations from Budget 2025With Budget 2025 approaching, people are expecting key reforms like simpler taxes and relief for the middle class.
From tomatoes to tiramisu: India's most delivered items in 2024India's 2024 delivery trends reveal rising demand for food, fashion, and documents, as per Borzo.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif's attacker changed clothes, likely took train from Bandra, new pic showsA new picture of Saif Ali Khan's attacker has emerged, which shows him in a different set of clothes than what he was wearing in the earlier visuals. Police suspect that the attacker likely took a train from Bandra to move around Mumbai or to travel to another place.

'India-US trade ties trending positive': Elon Musk hosts Indian business leadersTech billionaire Elon Musk hosted a delegation of leading Indian business leaders at his SpaceX Starbase facility in Texas and batted for enhanced trade ties between the two countries.

Champions Trophy squad selection: What to expect from India's 15-man line-up?  Live UpdatesChampions Trophy: Captain Rohit Sharma and chief selector Ajit Agarkar will meet the press in Mumbai after announcing India's much-awaited squad. The team for the upcoming three-match ODI will also be announced on Saturday.

'They want my money': Lucknow man accused by in-laws of wife's murder in ThailandPriyanka, a woman from Lucknow on a holiday with her husband and son in Thailand, was found dead in a hotel room in Pattaya. Her family accused her husband Ashish of murder, who in turn denied the allegation, and said his in-laws wanted to extort money from him.
Can glycolic acid really solve all your skin and body care woes?Glycolic acid is a potent alpha-hydroxy acid (AHA) known for its exfoliating and collagen-boosting properties.

Day 7 Live Updates: Balaji exits in Round 2, Swiatek, Navarro winAustralian Open 2025 Day 7 Live Updates: India's N. Balaji and his Mexican partner Miguel Angel Reyes-Varela's valiant effort has gone in vain as they exited the men's doubles in the second round. The Indo-Mexican pair were beaten by Borges-Cabral in a hard-fought three-set contest. Earlier in the day, Iga Swiatek steamrolled past Emma Raducanu to win their 3rd round clash in straight sets. Emma Navarro defeated Ons Jabeur in a three-set thriller to make it to the next round.

Auto driver who took injured Saif Ali Khan to hospital recreates fateful rideBhajan Singh Rana, the auto driver who ferried an injured Saif Ali Khan to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital after he was stabbed by an intruder multiple times, recounted the route he took from the actor's home to the hospital.

Israeli security cabinet approves deal on Gaza truce and release of hostagesThe Israeli security cabinet approved a ceasefire deal that would allow the return of the first hostages from war-torn Gaza and halt the 15-month-old war between the Jewish nation and Hamas.

Video: Chris Martin visits Lord Shiva temple with Dakota Johnson in MumbaiColdplay's frontman Chris Martin and his girlfriend, actor Dakota Johnson dismissed their breakup rumours as they arrived together at a Mumbai temple on Thursday. The photos and videos of their visit are being shared widely on social media.

TikTok, facing US ban, says it will go dark on Sunday unless Biden intervenesTikTok's statement came hours after the Supreme Court upheld a law banning the app in the United States on national security grounds if its Chinese parent company ByteDance does not sell it.

Video: Journalist bodily removed for heckling 'criminal Blinken' at final briefingThe briefing, which occurred a day after Qatar announced a ceasefire deal between Israel Hamas, saw independent journalist Sam Husseini and Grayzone News editor Max Blumenthal tearing into Antony Blinken.

Kolkata court verdict on RG Kar rape-murder today: The case so farA court in Kolkata will give its verdict in the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar hospital on August 9 last year. Here's a timeline of the events in the case, which shook the nation.

Maha Kumbh 2025: Getting lost and finding your way back at PrayagrajThough 80s cinema popularised the term 'Kumbh me bichdha hua', it might be next to impossible to get separated forever at Kumbh in this day of technology. These are what visitors to Maha Kumbh 2025 need to keep in mind to not lose their way or to find their family members quickly at the Prayagraj Sangam. Here's a map of the sectors to help you navigate through the expanse of the Kumbh Mela ground.
TV actor Aman Jaiswal, 22, dies after truck hits his bike in MumbaiDhartiputra Nandini actor Aman Jaiswal, 22, died in a road accident. Writer Dhiraj Mishra confirmed the news to India Today Digital.

Trump's swearing-in to be held indoors due to freezing cold, a first in 40 yearsPresident-elect Donald Trump's inauguration will take place inside the US Capitol on January 20 in view of the forecast for freezing temperatures in Washington DC.

US teacher had 13-year-old boy's baby, abused him for 4 years; arrested: ReportLaura Caron, a fifth-grade teacher at an elementary school in New Jersey, engaged in a sexual relationship with her student from 2016 to 2020.

12 Indians fighting for Russia in Ukraine war killed, 16 'missing': GovernmentThe Ministry of External Affairs said 12 Indians have been killed while fighting for Russia in the ongoing war and 16 others have been missing.

Biden commutes sentences of 2,500 non-violent offenders in a day, sets recordOutgoing US President Joe Biden called the move "an important step toward righting historic wrongs, correcting sentencing disparities, and providing deserving individuals the opportunity to return to their families."

Couple light fireplace to beat cold, dies of suffocation after leaving it burningThe couple lit a fireplace due to the cold, took it inside their room and fell asleep with the door closed, due to which they died of suffocation. However, the locals did not inform the police and their bodies were cremated.

Vishwak Sen's Laila teaser out, film to release in MarchThe teaser of Vishwak Sen-starrer Laila has been released. The Telugu action comedy features him in dual roles, portraying both Sonu Model and the character of Laila.

Dinesh Karthik questions Hardik Pandya's removal from vice captaincy in T20IsFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Dinesh Karthik has questioned Hardik Pandya's removal from the vice-captaincy of the Indian T20I side.

India squad announcement live: Focus on Bumrah fitness, No place for Samson?ICC Champions Trophy 2025 India squad announcement live: All eyes will be on chief selector Ajit Agarkar as he is set to announce India's squad for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Agarkar is set to address a press conference in Mumbai to reveal the members of the squad for the 8 team tournament. The big focus will be on Jasprit Bumrah and his fitness as the Indian pacer is being monitored after suffering back spasms during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Reports also suggest that Sanju Samson and Karun Nair may miss out on making the cut.

Iga Swiatek breezes past Emma Raducanu in straight sets, Emma Navarro winsFormer World No.1 Iga Swiatek continued her fine run at the Australian Open 2025 as she steamrolled past Emma Raducanu in straight sets to progress to Round 4 on Saturday, January 18. Swiatek won the match in an hour and 10 minutes as Raducanu struggled to put up a fight against the Polish star. Emma Navarro secured a hard-fought win against Ons Jabeur to make it to Round 4.

PSG announce big-money signing of Khvicha Kvaratskhelia from NapoliParis Saint-Germain have finally got their man as the Ligue 1 giants announced the signing of Khvicha Kvaratskhelia from Napoli on Friday, January 17. The Georgian forward has joined the club on a deal until 2029.

Premier League: Manchester United legend Denis Law dies at 84Manchester United announced on Friday, January 17 that club legend and former Ballon d'Or winner Denis Law has died at the age of 84. Law was considered to be one of the finest footballers of his generation.

On Friday, January 17, the young shooter was honoured with the esteemed Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by President Droupadi Murmu.

Virat Kohli can play county cricket in England before Test series: Sanjay Manjrekar Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar urged Virat Kohli to play County Championship before the five-Test series in England, starting June 20. Kohli last played domestic cricket in the 2012-13 season.

Former India coach WV Raman recalls near-death experience, thanks Chennai doctorsFormer India coach WV Raman has shared his scary near-death experience on social media. Raman then confirmed that he was fine and thanked the Chennai hospital's doctors for saving him.

No place for Karun Nair in India squad despite Vijay Hazare heroicsChampions Trophy 2025: Karun Nair will not be picked in India's squad for the ICC tournament, sources told India Today. Nair has been in sensational form with the bat in domestic cricket.

India's likely squad: Bumrah to be picked, no place for Samson and NairChampions Trophy 2025: Jasprit Bumrah is all set to be picked in the 15-man squad, but his availability is subject to fitness. Sources told India Today that Sanju Samson and Karun Nair are unlikely to be considered for the premier 50-over tournament, starting February 19 in Pakistan and Dubai.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
